intro: Rhamnus wilsonii var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy buckthorn, is a shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, oval leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small yellow flowers in early spring, followed by dark purple berries in the autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or rocky areas. Its hairy foliage and ornamental berries make it a distinctive plant in its native habitat.
